Description: Rim and wall fragment of pottery lid; underside reserved; top slipped with black bands and further black line to centre; part of what seems to have been an elaborate knob preserved, perhaps in shape of an animal.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ11 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

"ΦII" in pencil on the outside. Provenance uncertain, pottery ledger notes that this object was "not on list" (EEF list). Found with P.5992. NA anaysis (by Hans Mommsen, Bonn) proved inconclusive (chemical loner), see Schlotzhauer 2012, 191-2 no. Nau 173.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 221, no. 88)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (NAU 173, pl. 6c-d.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.400)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6074 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
